title: League of Legends has lost connection to Maestro
body:
Hello I recently received the above error after logging in. After about 3-5 minutes I lose connection to maestro. I have tried all the options in the tool box. I have also done a full re-install.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.
maestro log:

INFO: maestro [server] initializing...
INFO: New thread go!
INFO: Starting Process Thread Spinning
INFO: Using registered HWND: 00000000 to launch the air client.
INFO: StartProcess [MAESTROPROCESSTYPE_AIR] successful
INFO: [MaestroMessageAgent_ReadFromSocketInternal] The operation completed successfully.

WARNING: Received 0 bytes on Maestro socket when data was expected.

replies.body:
Getting a Maestro error almost always is due to some kind of connection issue.  Maestro is the service that essentially makes sure you are still connected to the PvP.net Servers.  If it fails and gives an error, then it essentially recognized that you lost your connection.  I know you said that you've tried a lot of different steps already, but make sure you've completed every single step in our [Connection Issues Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues).  There are a lot of steps there, but they are all crucial in hopefully resolving this issue.

Let me know if nothing seems to help!

The change of dns did the trick! So far so good.

Thanks for the link, through google I ended up on older threads.

I just got the same error too like 5 min ago but now mine is fixed now. i was starting the client from a shortcut pinned to the task manager when i got the error but after unpinning the shortcut and starting the client from the lol folder it is magically fixed now. Dont know if that will fix it for u but give it a try.
